com.jmex.physics
Class Joint

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.Joint
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme.util.export.Savable
public abstract class Joint
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jme.util.export.Savable

A Joint constraints the relative location and rotation of two PhysicsNodes. By default a Joint does not allow to move any relative position or rotation change between the nodes. Axes can be added to allow movement in a specific direction or rotation around specific axes. Commonly a Joint can have only 6 axes. Some implementations may choose to allow 3 axes for positions plus 3 different axes for rotation but commonly translation and rotation axes will be equal. Commonly the axes should be perpendicular.

Author:
Irrisor
See Also:
PhysicsSpace.createJoint()

attach

public abstract void attach(DynamicPhysicsNode leftNode,
                            DynamicPhysicsNode rightNode)
Attach this Joint to two dynamic physics nodes. All formerly attached nodes are detached.

Parameters:
leftNode - first node this joint is attached to, not null
rightNode - second node this joint is attached to, not null
See Also:
attach(com.jmex.physics.DynamicPhysicsNode), detach()

attach

public abstract void attach(DynamicPhysicsNode node)
Attach this Joint to a single dynamic physics node. This Joint then constraints the abolute translation and/or rotation of the node (relative the the space). All formerly attached nodes are detached.

Parameters:
node - the only node this joint is attached to, not null
See Also:
attach(DynamicPhysicsNode, DynamicPhysicsNode), detach()

detach

public abstract void detach()
Detach this joint from all nodes. Effectively disables the joint.

See Also:
attach(DynamicPhysicsNode, DynamicPhysicsNode), attach(DynamicPhysicsNode)

getNodes

public abstract java.util.List<? extends DynamicPhysicsNode> getNodes()
Query a list of nodes connected via this joint. This may contain 0 to 2 nodes. The list cannot be altered. To alter is use the attach(com.jmex.physics.DynamicPhysicsNode, com.jmex.physics.DynamicPhysicsNode) and detach() methods.

Returns:
a list of dynamic nodes connected via this joint.

reset

public abstract void reset()
Reset the joint as if it has just been created.

setAnchor

public abstract void setAnchor(com.jme.math.Vector3f anchor)
Sets the anchor of this joint. The point in specified in world coordinate space if the joint attaches a single node to the world. If two nodes are attached the anchor is specified in coordinate space of the first node.

Parameters:
anchor - new anchor point

getAnchor

public abstract com.jme.math.Vector3f getAnchor(com.jme.math.Vector3f store)
Query the anchor of this node. The passed in Vector3f will be populated with the values, and then returned. The point in specified in world coordinate space if the joint attaches a single node to the world. If two nodes are attached the anchor is specified in coordinate space of the first node.

Parameters:
store - where to store the anchor (null to create a new vector)
Returns:
store

setSpring

public abstract void setSpring(float springConstant,
                               float dampingCoefficient)
Makes the joint 'softer' as a spring. Invoke with NaN to apply default stiffness.

Parameters:
springConstant - spring constant
dampingCoefficient - damping coefficient
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not supported for the current axis conficuration
